question: Which of the following is correct about EMF of a cell?
option1: it is the potential difference between the electrodes when current is flowing in the cell
option2: it is the drift velocity of the electrons when there is no current in the cell
option3: it is the potential difference between the electrodes when there is no current in the cell
answer: it is the potential difference between the electrodes when there is no current in the cell
explanation: Emf is defined as the potential difference between electrodes when there is no current in the cell(cell is in open circuit).
